sub_title: Learning and Development Manager Benelux and EU Coordinator at ICL Group
summary:
Personal and professional human development specialist. 
Focused on (youth) employability, (TVET) education, behavioural change and soft skills development with focus on career guidance, work ethics and international development. 
Experienced in strategic business development, operations, and people and project management.

In this position, I lead the L&OD team Europe in supporting their local target groups and their alignment with the global L&OD strategy. 

Together with the Global L&OD team, we set out strategies to improve and support the learning and development of all employees of ICL globally through all tools we have available, including our AI driven learning platform. 

In addition, in my passion to increase gender equality, I created and lead the Female Leadership Employee Resource Group Europe, and I’m a Diversity Inclusion and Belonging ambassador. Also coordinating the Female Refugee Mentoring Program Europe.', 'title': 'Learning and Development Manager Benelux and EU Coordinator', 'employment_type': None}]}, {'company': {'id': None, 'name': 'Schooling for Life', 'logo': None, 'url': None, 'employees': {'start': None, 'end': None}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 11, 'day': None, 'year': 2010}, 'end': {'month': 12, 'day': None, 'year': 2021}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Freetown, Sierra Leone', 'date': {'start': {'month': 11, 'day': None, 'year': 2010}, 'end': {'month': 12, 'day': None, 'year': 2021}}, 'company': 'Schooling for Life', 'description': 'The mission of Schooling for Life is to support young, talented youths in Sierra Leone to fulfil their right to education and self-development.
The goal: to bridge the gap between youth who can not find meaningful employment and employers who can not find skilled local employees.
As the founder of Schooling for Life, I wrote and developed the Skills for a Successful Future programme based on my double local research in Sierra Leone in 2008 and 2012. 
The programme consists of three pillars: (1) Scholarship for tertiary vocational education (2) Employability Skills training (3) Personal guidance (behavioural change and character building)

During the COVID-19 pandemic, we built an online platform for our students within two months in order to continue the third semester skills classes of the academic year 2019/2020; a comprehensive trial run was done to make sure the platform was fully equipped to function within the local context. The third semester was successfully finalised by the end of 2020.
https://schoolingforlife.net/', 'title': 'Founder and Country Director', 'employment_type': None}]}, {'company': {'id': None, 'name': 'Sierra Leone TVET Coalition', 'logo': None, 'url': None, 'employees': {'start': None, 'end': None}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 4, 'day': None, 'year': 2015}, 'end': {'month': 5, 'day': None, 'year': 2021}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Sierra Leone', 'date': {'start': {'month': 4, 'day': None, 'year': 2015}, 'end': {'month': 5, 'day': None, 'year': 2021}}, 'company': 'Sierra Leone TVET Coalition', 'description': "As an active member of the Sierra Leone TVET Coalition, I participated in several committees, focused on improving understanding of the TVET sector and bringing youth and employers closer together.
Some working groups and committees I participated in: 
- Co-founder and member of the Coalition's Steering Committee
- Research team that developed the Skills Needs Assessment report (https://www.giz.de/en/downloads/giz2018-en-skills-assessment-sierra-leone.pdf)
- Job Fair working group; organised the first ever TVET job fair in Sierra Leone with over 300 participants
- Schools Outreach working group; the goal was to create more awareness on the benefits of studying and working in the TVET sector, for both teachers and students in secondary education. We developed and carried out a 3-day training for 70 TVET teachers across 5 schools on the importance of TVET, how to create classroom safety, effective communication, and do’s/don’ts in career guidance
- Governance and Growth committee (Lead); focused on creating capacity building opportunities for the members of the Coalition to benefit from each other’s knowledge and expertise. Additionally aligning internal and external communication regarding Coalition's objectives and activities.

Objective of the Coalition: support the government of Sierra Leone in improving the employability of TVET graduates and strengthening the national TVET sector.
The Coalition therewith also promotes an environment that helps the development of the private sector in Sierra Leone and positions the country as an attractive investment destination.
https://tvetcoalition.wordpress.com/about/", 'title': 'Strategic Partner', 'employment_type': None}]}, {'company': {'id': 1664949, 'name': 'Deutsche Gesellschaft für Internationale Zusammenarbeit (GIZ) GmbH', 'logo': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/C4D0BAQF_OP8utXDGgA/company-logo_400_400/0/1547029282347?e=1700697600&v=beta&t=wWMnv3jlioL29x6eZ4UB6yf5m9f9MurlqxX2FiM_5kk', 'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/company/gizgmbh/', 'employees': {'start': 10001, 'end': None}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 11, 'day': None, 'year': 2018}, 'end': {'month': 4, 'day': None, 'year': 2019}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Freetown, Sierra Leone', 'date': {'start': {'month': 11, 'day': None, 'year': 2018}, 'end': {'month': 4, 'day': None, 'year': 2019}}, 'company': 'Deutsche Gesellschaft für Internationale Zusammenarbeit (GIZ) GmbH', 'description': '- Project: Principles of Teaching – Training of Master Trainers
